Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AA139 (synthetic AMPs20a, Arenicin-3 analog, 2S=S, UCSS1a; rAA139)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (85.71%) toArenicin-3R: 24%; C: 19%.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 4.0 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 2-16.0 ug/ml), K. pneumonia (MIC 8.0 ug/ml), A. baumannii (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. faecium (MIC 16.0 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 8.0 ug/ml), and C. acnes (MIC 63.0 ug/ml).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: BL21 (DE3) strain, SUMO fusion, recombinant AA139 (rAA139) at a yield 56 mg/L, purity: >98% (Zhang et al., 2024; cf.: other expression methods with yields: 0.8-9.7 mg/L).Updated 6/2024
Literature Information.Author: van der Weide H, Vermeulen-de Jongh DMC, van der Meijden A, Boers SA, Kreft D, Ten Kate MT, Falciani C, Pini A, Strandh M, Bakker-Woudenberg IAJM, Hays JP, Goessens WHF. 2019
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2019 Aug;54(2):159-166. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2019.05.019.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial activity of two novel antimicrobial peptides AA139 and SET-M33 against clinically and genotypically diverse Klebsiella pneumoniae isolates with differing antibiotic resistance profiles.
